grants.description: The creation of a virtual centre to support the engagement of older people as volunteers in the community and to provide advice on local services. There will be an active link to GP surgeries to connect patients with relevant volunteers.

grants.title: Agoraphobia Free
grants.description: A multiplatform mobile app to improve agoraphobia using exposure therapy both 'in virtuo' and 'in vivo'.  'In virtuo' using virtual crowded spaces such as shops, buses or trains featuring simulated crowds.  'In vivo' using the GPS and other sensors on the device to set and track real exposure goals.

grants.description: StudentFunder has moved beyond just being a crowdfunding platform and is using crowdfunding to provide loans. To support this, the team is expanding and becoming more professional.

grants.title: Flood Volunteers

grants.title: Disability Rocks ﾖ Open Access Project
grants.description: 24/7 dedicated booking and information line for live entertainment and events using multi channels of technology, reducing barriers for an increased range of disabilities. In collaboration with a virtual PA service and research agency, offering a tailored service to accommodate a much wider range of individual needs. Also working with existing venues and ticketing agencies to improve industry standards with ongoing review.

grants.title: EduKit
grants.description: An online platform that will help young people by evaluating their personal development needs and identifying programmes run by charities that can help them. As teachers will be able to evaluate each programme, the site will act as a ﾑTripAdvisor' for programmes that help young people.

grants.title: Soulight
grants.description: Developing a mobile wellness assistant that helps any smartphone user with their mental and emotional well-being in a pleasant, seamless way. Powered by their unique music technology, it uses responsive music to mirror the userﾒs emotional state to create emotional self-awareness, and by delivering personalized musical health journeys.

grants.title: Flowy
grants.description: Next stage funding for the Flowy mobile game, supporting delivery of Playlab's marketing and communications strategy.

grants.title: My Stroke Guide

grants.title: The Collaborative Charity Web Platform. Leveraging creative talent for change.
grants.description: Make an open collaborative charity platform, where more pro bono or paid web designers can make a difference to charities by leveraging a scalable, social and safe web platform

grants.title: BYZ emotional fitness tool
grants.description: Engaging young people in mapping their own stories and personal development as a result of being a member of the Youth Zone.  Gathering a rich level of data to support the impact of BYZ's emotional fitness focussed youth work approach.

grants.title: Youth Web Builders (YWB)
grants.description: Matching young people with inherent digital skills to businesses that do not have digital coverage.  It builds upon and complements DYAﾒs social digital media solutions enabling SMEs to become digital online whilst enabling young people to achieve recognised qualifications, practical experience and work skills.

grants.title: The Impact Assessment App
grants.description: Create a tool to change the way health and social care policy is shaped, by giving disconnected and disadvantaged people a direct and daily voice in policy making.

grants.title: Deaf Children and Young People ﾖ just ASK
grants.description: Deaf young people aged 11-16 will develop online tools (including videos) that will help other deaf young people to better understand issues of internet safety.

grants.title: Scaling Tyze in the UK
grants.description: Improve health and social outcomes for individuals and caregivers, while also saving significant time and money for formal care providers by  hosting up to 2500 carer networks in the UK.

grants.title: myGOSH
grants.description: A digital environment, enabled through patient Bring Your Own Devices (BYOD) that will connect securely to the Great Ormond Street Hospital WiFi network to offer free entertainment, communication & collaboration tools, and medical information for patients.

grants.title: Autism employability
grants.description: Creating a bridge between an excluded group (individuals with ASD) and organisations who require their unique skills. Recruiting, assessing, training and placing these individuals into client organisations.

grants.title: Founders4Schools
grants.description: Founders4Schools links teachers with entrepreneurs to inspire school children about entrepreneurship as a high impact career choice. It uses technology and is as easy to arrange as buying a book on amazon and is free and highly scaleable. Events last for one hour and four entrepreneurs talk to the students about their entrepreneurial journeys.

grants.title: iRights: Empowering children and young people online
grants.description: The iRights initiative envisages a future where the fundamental right of children and young people to access the internet creatively, knowledgeably and fearlessly is fulfilled. We believe that Nominet would be engaged with a significant new movement to support digital inclusion.

grants.title: Wearable sensors for care management
grants.description:
We are developing an Internet-enabled platform for the analysis of long-term
physical activity and behaviour, collected by wearable sensors, in advanced
age, with the aim of identifying social withdrawal and altered behavioural
patterns that are predictive for decreased quality of life and need for social care
interventions.

grants.title: Bi-lingual pharmacy dispensing labels
grants.description:
Our goal is to commercially launch our internet-enabled pharmacy translation
software, which accurately translates medical information for the 5 million UK
residents who speak English as a second language. We want to measure the
improvement in pharmaceutical care when a pharmacist uses our software to
break down communication barriers with patients.

grants.title: Viral Academy
grants.description: The Viral Academy will create employment opportunities for hundreds of young people through training them how to create mobile and business applications, We will use a combination of social incentive, and new technology to solve this problem, in the process creating a new type of sustainable business.

grants.title: Tell the Doctor
grants.description: Tell the Doctor is a digital solution that will improve management of chronic diseases, which affect millions of people in the UK (prototype is aimed at allergy patients). Support us to achieve our goal of improving the quality of life of sufferers and reducing the financial burden on the NHS.

grants.title: Cognitive Clinical Decisions
grants.description:
Andiamo is building a cloud based application with the IBM Watson team that
will allow clinicians to upload 3D body scans to a collaborative cloud platform.
This platform will also contain the latest biomechanics research, enabling better
orthotic treatment for children with disabilities and long term conditions.

grants.title: ChangeAlert
grants.description:
We have developed a moisture sensor for continence pads, which sends a signal to a
bracelet the carer wears, as soon as the pad is wet and needs to be changed. For care
home settings a display will show moisture levels for all patients. The product will improve
the day-to-day life of the pad user and make the work of the caregiver easier.

grants.title: busk.co
grants.description: Weﾒve created a digital toolkit for street performers, enabling them to get cashless payments, sell their music in the street, and facilitate one-to-one engagement with their audiences. Busking is increasingly criminalised worldwide, despite giving disenfranchised people an honourable income. Weﾒre the only organisation protecting and advancing this at-risk, historic tradition!

grants.title: Canute
grants.description:
We are working to reverse the decline in literacy amongst blind people
through assisted technology by making a low-cost, multi-line, digital
Braille e-book reader that is a radical departure from everything
currently available on the market.

grants.title: Supporting young people through mobile devices
grants.description: YouthNet will explore young people's use and perceptions of using mobile devices for information, advice and guidance.

recipientOrganization.name: Social Value Network UK ( formerly The SROI Network)

grants.title: The Global Value Exchange
grants.description: The Global Value Exchange (GVE) is a crowd sourced database that is democratising impact measurement information. The site has become a unique component of the impact measurement ecosystem. This project will make the global value exchange a website that organisations will use in order to understand their social value, improve their impact and access new funding.

grants.title: Digital transformation in the social sector
grants.description: A programme designed to accelerate the adoption of digital technology in the social sector by bringing together charity and technology partners and highlighting opportunities for action. This project will transform the way the social sector operates at a structural level ﾗ encouraging integration, collaboration and efficiency in its fundamental architecture.

grants.title: Digital Families
grants.description: MakerClub and NIACE to co design a range of interactive digital courses that use microcontrollers and 3D printing to help encourage family learning of digital skills with hands-on, low cost robotics and a browser based learning platform.  Help lower the entry barrier for thousands of disadvantaged families.

grants.title: Using Social Media to widen Young Peoples participation in Social Work education
grants.description: A systematic review of Social Media (e.g. social networks, blogs, video conferencing) used by service users to share experiences and contribute to knowledge. The aim is to identify how use can widen young peopleﾒs participation in Social Work education.

grants.title: The Projects Sharing Engine
grants.description: To help community groups build more resilient communities, the ﾑProjects Sharing Engineﾒ will enable users to view, publish and edit project case studies on their own websites.

grants.title: SpeakSet
grants.description: SpeakSet is a set-top-box that turns the TV into a really simple video calling device. It has been designed specifically for older users to combat isolation in old age. This is an application to part fund pilot trials with four organisations: Age UK,

grants.title: OurHousing
grants.description: OurHousing is a narrative orientated web platform and trusted intermediary for social landlords and tenants nation-wide.

grants.title: Centre 81 Community Based Learning Project
grants.description: Community based learning for excluded young people, older people and those with learning difficulties in deprived area of Whitecrook.

grants.title: Community Storytelling Project
grants.description: Creating low cost, crowd sourced, value-led community evaluations; building effective feedback loops between organizations and citizens. Recruiting young people (scribes) who collect personal narratives that map complex social problems & local needs, leading to the datafication and rapid analysis of emerging issues.

grants.title: Get Connected App Development
grants.description: Developing and launch a free app so that young people have instant in hand ﾑone-tapﾒ access to free, confidential help when they need it ﾖ solving a problem before it becomes a crisis.

grants.title: runaclub.com
grants.description: It is a fully interactive, accessible, supported, web-based toolkit and step-by-step guide, for any community wanting to run a club/event.

grants.title: Micro-activity for job market entrants.
grants.description:
We will launch online markets for young peopleﾒs spare hours. Within individual controls, these hours can be booked for micro-volunteering, micro-work, etc.

This will allow flexible activity around changing requirements of job-seeking/studying.

grants.title: Housing Data Everything
grants.description: Establishing and pioneering new common standards for big data and open data in the affordable housing sector, increasing openness and accountability in the housing sector and enabling insight into the ways in which data can drive improved service delivery to residents, maximising housing providers' social impact.

grants.title: Proof of concept for wiki-based web content management in the voluntary sector
grants.description: KnowHow NonProfit delivers online guidance and learning resources to the Voluntary and Community Sector (VCS) in the UK ﾖ with a particular emphasis on peer-to-peer, social learning.

grants.title: Get IT Together in Rhondda Cynon Taf
grants.description: A community development approach to digital inclusion. Young people will develop employability skills by working across RCT to teach older people how to get online. The project will learn from and share practice with two other Welsh projects.

grants.title: Safe Secondary
grants.description: Safe Secondary will use peer education to instil responsible social networking by turning older pupils into educators, inspiring younger pupils. In the process, they are motivated to act responsibly online.

grants.title: Munch Poke Ping
grants.description: Creating, disseminating and scaling up a series of positive, creative E-safety resources targeted at staff working with vulnerable young people in Pupil Referral Units.

grants.title: The Great British Public Toilet Map
grants.description: Collecting, opening-up and mapping data about the location and details of all UK publicly accessible toilets, through open data and crowd-sourcing. The map exists as a prototype for a small area, needing resources (time, funding, mentoring) to become useful and sustainable.

grants.title: Deaf Computer Course
grants.description: Providing computer awareness to Deaf people, allowing them to independently connect to the internet and use webcams.

grants.title: Peace of Mind (POM)
grants.description: Enabling carers and relatives to monitor that medication is taken at the correct time and detect falls or inactivity for people living alone.  The app helps elderly people to live independently in their own home and delay entering a care home.

grants.title: Well Connected

grants.title: Virtual walking: rich mobile communications to enhance social interaction and cultural participation for isolated individuals
grants.description: Enable an audio-visual link between a housebound individual and a ﾑmobile partnerﾒ allowing a one-to-one talk that is strongly contextualized permittingthem to recover a degree of re-engagement with their local community.

grants.title: RLSB Conversational Internet
grants.description: To develop an internet "user-interface" based on conversational interactions between people and machines primarily for those unable to use screens, keyboards or a mouse (e.g.: blind people).

grants.title: DITS (Digital Inclusion Through Schools)
grants.description: Intergenerational project working with local school, using their computer suite after school for their pupils to be the tutors for the older people, who become the students.
